page.title: 04Population Coniston/Swine
page.content: Coniston's (1983) population of 270 is a peculiar blend of 'old' and 'new'. The former are mainly agricultural workersor of elderly country folk who live in the heart of the village itself. The 'new' element comprise a more modern generation of Hull commuters living in newer houses bordering the main A165 Hull to Bridlington road. Curiously the two communities keep to themselves and the commuters rarely take part in village activities or use its amenities. Swine is a dead end village with its (1983) population of 170 country folk living in attractive 18th and 19th century brick cottages strung along its single street. The whole area is extremely isolated,but all the inhabitants appear to be content in living there and none would admit to welcoming change in its status or environment.
